Facility Name: Dynamic Metal Treating
Canton, MI  48187
RMP Facility ID: _____________________

Executive Summary

Dynamic Metal Treating has prepared his executive summary in conformance with the provisions of 40 CFR 68.155.

1. Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the stationary source:

Dynamic Metal Treating has adheres to the Federal and State regulations and in compliance with the OSHA requirements for handling of anhydrous ammonia and the OSHA process management standard. Employees of the facilities are trained in their roles and responsibilities in implementing prevention and emergency response. Should an emergency occur, it the company's policy to notify the Canton Township Fire department and request that they respond to the emergency situation 

2. Stationary source and regulated substances handled:

Anhydrous ammonia is stored in a bulk tank at the facility. The facility is a commercial heat treating facility.

3. The worst case release scenario and the alternative release scenario including the administrative controls and mitigation measures to limit the distances for the reported scenarios:

The worst-case scenario for the facility is the potential accidental release of the anhydrous ammonia from the tank when full. The distance corresponding to the release of 52000 lbs of ammonia release is 2.60 miles.

The alternative release scenario is the release through the transfer line connecting the tank with the transfer hose of anhydrous ammonia delivery truck that loads the tank. The transfer occurs in a supervised environment. If this scenario were to occur, the liquid in the transfer line empties out followed by the check valve shut-off thus limiting the loss to the contents of the line (approximately 50 lbs). The supervisor/attendant will then close the main valve at the tank. The maximum distance corresponding to the this release is less than 0.1 miles.



4. The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-spec

ific prevention steps:

The design, installation and maintenance of anhydrous ammonia tank is performed in conformance with ANSI standards, state and local regulations. Facility personnel have been trained in safe handling procedures of the chemical. The facility is in compliance with the applicable regulations. The loading of anhydrous ammonia is conducted with extreme safety. All the transfer operations are monitored and follow a written standard operating procedure (SOP)



5. The five-year accident history

None

6. The emergency response program:

In the event of an emergency, the facility will immediately notify the Canton Township Fire Department for an emergency response measures.


7. Planned changes to improve safety
The Facility will train their employees on an on-going basis. The safety systems and preventive measures are constantly evaluated and improved.
